intro: Pimelea dura, commonly known as the hard pimelea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Thymelaeaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in late winter to early spring. The plant typically grows in heathlands and dry sclerophyll forests, preferring well-drained soils. Its foliage consists of narrow, leathery leaves that are adapted to reduce water loss in arid conditions. Pimelea dura is often found in coastal areas and is known for its resilience to harsh environmental conditions.
